html.p: What: Totally different from the behavior of append and appendcols because appendpipe is much smarter. It appends the results of the existing pipe to the search results.

ol.li:
appendpipe operates on that *same* data.
append and appendcols both operate on sets of data different from the "main search" data.

CAN ONLY be used after a generating command or a transforming command
Generating commands like makeresults or transforming commands like stats that output a table

html.p: How: ... (existing *transforming* or *generating* search) | appendpipe [(another summary-style search on that same data)]
Why: Unlike append and appendcols, appendpipe is a bit tricky to get your head around, but useful in several cases.
So What: You can use it to "inject totals" into the middle of other searches, lots of interesting use cases.

The data we are using for this command -
Data 1 - a previous makeresults:
Data 2 - an inputlookup we built earlier. To build this see outputlookup.
While yours may differ slightly, that data for us is:

panel.title: When we're done
panel.html: After using appendpipe to add per-hour totals

search.query: | inputlookup rich_and_dave_cars.csv | appendpipe [stats sum(cars) AS TOTAL_BY_HOUR by _time] ``` we have to re-sort by time to get them all back into order.``` | sort - _time ``` and then rearrange the columns ``` | table _time, salesperson, cars, TOTAL_BY_HOUR
